definition: (American football) putting the ball in play by passing it (between the legs) to a back, break suddenly and abruptly, as under tension
details:
noun
- (American football) putting the ball in play by passing it (between the legs) to a back
= example: (American football) putting the ball in play by passing it (between the legs) to a back
= synonyms: centering
- the act of catching an object with the hands
= synonyms: catch
- the act of snapping the fingers
- any undertaking that is easy to do
= synonyms: child's play, walkover, cinch, breeze, picnic, duck soup, pushover, piece of cake
- a fastener used on clothing
= example: a fastener used on clothing
= synonyms: snap fastener, press stud
- an informal photograph
= synonyms: shot, snapshot
- the tendency of a body to return to its original shape after it has been stretched or compressed
= example: the tendency of a body to return to its original shape after it has been stretched or compressed
= synonyms: elasticity
- a sudden breaking
- a sudden sharp noise
= synonyms: cracking, crack
- the noise produced by the rapid movement of a finger from the tip to the base of the thumb on the same hand
= example: the noise produced by the rapid movement of a finger from the tip to the base of the thumb on the same hand
- a crisp round cookie flavored with ginger
= synonyms: gingersnap, ginger snap, ginger nut
- tender green beans without strings that easily snap into sections
= synonyms: snap bean
- a spell of cold weather
= example: a spell of cold weather
= synonyms: cold spell, cold snap
verb
- break suddenly and abruptly, as under tension
= example: break suddenly and abruptly, as under tension
= synonyms: crack
- close with a snapping motion
= example: close with a snapping motion
- utter in an angry, sharp, or abrupt tone
= example: utter in an angry, sharp, or abrupt tone
= synonyms: snarl
- record on photographic film
= synonyms: shoot, photograph
- cause to make a snapping sound
= example: cause to make a snapping sound
= synonyms: click
- put in play with a snap
= example: put in play with a snap
- to grasp hastily or eagerly
= synonyms: snatch, snatch up
- bring the jaws together
= example: bring the jaws together
- separate or cause to separate abruptly
= example: separate or cause to separate abruptly
= synonyms: rupture, tear
- lose control of one's emotions
= synonyms: break down, lose it
- move or strike with a noise
= synonyms: click
- move with a snapping sound
= example: move with a snapping sound
- make a sharp sound
= example: make a sharp sound
= synonyms: crack
